name: Lemure
movement: slow walker with a speed of 15 feet
description: A formless mass of flesh groaning in eternal torment, the Lemure embodies the lowest form of devilish existence, reduced to its most basic form in the Nine Hells.
memorable: These creatures are nearly impossible to kill permanently, as they reform in the Hells after being slain.
goals: To serve as fodder in the wars between devils and demons, embodying the torment of lost souls.
relations: Often used by more powerful devils; part of the hierarchy of infernal creatures.
environment: Primarily found in the Nine Hells, serving as a reminder of eternal suffering.
strengths: Immunities to fire and poison damage, ability to see through magical darkness, and ability to reform after death.
weaknesses: Low Dexterity and Intelligence scores, making it vulnerable to agile and intelligent foes.
attacks: Uses a melee weapon attack called 'Fist,' dealing minimal bludgeoning damage.
most_powerful_ability: Hellish Rejuvenation allows it to come back to life within 1d10 days after dying in the Hells.
senses: Possesses darkvision with a range of 120 feet, allowing it to see in darkness.
skills: Has a passive Perception score of 10, which is average for detecting hidden threats.
additional_information: Radiates a Lawful Evil aura that affects interactions.
Eerie Groan can disorient nearby creatures within 300 feet.
Devil's Sight allows it to see in magical darkness.
Can create an aura of extreme heat that weakens non-devil creatures.
Reforms within 1 mile of where it was slain unless holy water is used on its remains.
test_queries: devil serving in the Nine Hells
